SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid syndrome is a disorder characterized by arterial and venous thromboses, thrombocytopaenia and stroke
Acute myocardial infarction is rarely associated with this syndrome
The treatment of these patients is a clinical challenge
This report is about a patient with antiphospholipid syndrome presenting with an acute myocardial infarction after an exercise test
The infarct-related coronary artery was successfully revascularized by primary angioplasty and stenting without any major bleeding complications
We think that the physical exertion could have favoured acute coronary thrombosis in this particular setting
